Detailed Description

CPView is a class which provides facilities for drawing in a window and receiving events. It is the superclass of many of the visual elements of the GUI.

In order to display itself, a view must be placed in a window (represented by an CPWindow object). Within the window is a hierarchy of CPViews, headed by the window's content view. Every other view in a window is a descendant of this view.

Subclasses can override -drawRect: in order to implement their appearance. Other methods of CPView and CPResponder can also be overridden to handle user generated events.

Definition at line 121 of file CPView.j.

Returns whether the receiver should be sent a -mouseDown: message for anEvent.
Returns YES by default.

Returns:
YES, if the view object accepts first mouse-down event. NO, otherwise.

00342                   :(CPView)aSubview positioned:(CPWindowOrderingMode)anOrderingMode relativeTo:(CPView)anotherView
00343 {
00344     var index = anotherView ? [_subviews indexOfObjectIdenticalTo:anotherView] : CPNotFound;
00345     
00346     // In other words, if no view, then either all the way at the bottom or all the way at the top.
00347     if (index === CPNotFound)
00348         index = (anOrderingMode === CPWindowAbove) ? [_subviews count] : 0;
00349     
00350     // else, if we have a view, above if above.
00351     else if (anOrderingMode === CPWindowAbove)
00352         ++index;
00353         
00354     [self _insertSubview:aSubview atIndex:index];
00355 }

02468     [super encodeWithCoder:aCoder];
02469     
02470     if (_tag !== -1)
02471         [aCoder encodeInt:_tag forKey:CPViewTagKey];

02474     [aCoder encodeRect:_bounds forKey:CPViewBoundsKey];
02475 
02476     // This will come out nil on the other side with decodeObjectForKey:
02477     if (_window !== nil)
02478         [aCoder encodeConditionalObject:_window forKey:CPViewWindowKey];
02479 
02480     var count = [_subviews count],
02481         encodedSubviews = _subviews;
02482 
02483     if (count > 0 && [_ephemeralSubviews count] > 0)
02484     {
02485         encodedSubviews = [encodedSubviews copy];
02486 
02487         while (count--)
02488             if ([_ephemeralSubviews containsObject:encodedSubviews[count]])
02489                 encodedSubviews.splice(count, 1);
02490     }
02491 
02492     if (encodedSubviews.length > 0)
02493         [aCoder encodeObject:encodedSubviews forKey:CPViewSubviewsKey];
02494 
02495     // This will come out nil on the other side with decodeObjectForKey:
02496     if (_superview !== nil)
02497         [aCoder encodeConditionalObject:_superview forKey:CPViewSuperviewKey];
02498

02506         [aCoder encodeObject:_backgroundColor forKey:CPViewBackgroundColorKey];

02510

02512         [aCoder encodeFloat:_opacity forKey:CPViewOpacityKey];

02515         [aCoder encodeBool:_isHidden forKey:CPViewIsHiddenKey];
02516

02520         [aCoder encodeConditionalObject:nextKeyView forKey:CPViewNextKeyViewKey];

- (BOOL) scrollRectToVisible: (CGRect)  aRect   [implementation]

Scrolls the nearest ancestor CPClipView a minimum amount so aRect can become visible.

Parameters:
aRect the area to become visible
Returns:
<codeYES if any scrolling occurred, NO otherwise.

Definition at line 1854 of file CPView.j.

01854                            :(CGRect)aRect
01855 {
01856     var visibleRect = [self visibleRect];
01857     
01858     // Make sure we have a rect that exists.
01859     aRect = CGRectIntersection(aRect, _bounds);
01860     
01861     // If aRect is empty or is already visible then no scrolling required.
01862     if (_CGRectIsEmpty(aRect) || CGRectContainsRect(visibleRect, aRect))
01863         return NO;
01864 
01865     var enclosingClipView = [self _enclosingClipView];
01866     
01867     // If we're not in a clip view, then there isn't much we can do.
01868     if (!enclosingClipView)
01869         return NO;
01870     
01871     var scrollPoint = _CGPointMakeCopy(visibleRect.origin);
01872             
01873     // One of the following has to be true since our current visible rect didn't contain aRect.
01874     if (_CGRectGetMinX(aRect) <= _CGRectGetMinX(visibleRect))
01875         scrollPoint.x = _CGRectGetMinX(aRect);
01876     else if (_CGRectGetMaxX(aRect) > _CGRectGetMaxX(visibleRect))
01877         scrollPoint.x += _CGRectGetMaxX(aRect) - _CGRectGetMaxX(visibleRect);
01878     
01879     if (_CGRectGetMinY(aRect) <= _CGRectGetMinY(visibleRect))
01880         scrollPoint.y = CGRectGetMinY(aRect);
01881     else if (_CGRectGetMaxY(aRect) > _CGRectGetMaxY(visibleRect))
01882         scrollPoint.y += _CGRectGetMaxY(aRect) - _CGRectGetMaxY(visibleRect);
01883     
01884     [enclosingClipView scrollToPoint:CGPointMake(scrollPoint.x, scrollPoint.y)];
01885
